intro: Neolobivia kratochviliana, commonly known as the Kratochvíla's lobivia, is a succulent plant native to the arid regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its cylindrical stems covered in spines. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It is adapted to thrive in well-drained soil and full sun exposure. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is often cultivated by cactus enthusiasts.
